summary: This document is an email chain between FBI Special Agents discussing potential assistance with the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails focus on organizing evidence and reviewing audio calls for discovery purposes, with a target to turn around some discovery by the end of August 2020.

persons.name: SA =I
persons.context: The recipient of the initial email, expressing interest in assisting with the Epstein case and requesting a phone call for more information.

persons.name: SA M
persons.context: The recipient of the initial inquiry about assistance, copied on the email chain discussing the types of help needed for the Epstein case.

connections.description: Both are FBI Special Agents corresponding about work on the Epstein case, indicating a professional working relationship.

events.title: Initial Assistance Inquiry
events.description: An FBI Special Agent inquires about the type of assistance needed for the Epstein case, specifically asking about dates and type of work.

events.title: Follow-up on Case Assistance
events.description: An FBI Special Agent follows up on the initial inquiry, expressing interest in assisting with the Epstein case and requesting a phone call to obtain more information.

events.title: Discovery Preparation Deadline
events.description: The FBI team is working to prepare evidence for discovery with a target to turn around some items by the end of August 2020.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively working on the Epstein case in July-August 2020, preparing evidence for discovery.
The assistance needed included reviewing audio calls and organizing items, with some work possible remotely from any computer.
There was a target to turn around some discovery by the end of August 2020.
The correspondence shows internal FBI coordination on the Epstein investigation.
The document references the 'Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking' unit of the FBI New York Field Office.
